full_text:
In the Court of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate,
Thiruvananthapuram
Present: Elsa Catherine George
Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate.
Dated the 4" day of March 2025
CC: 722/2023
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police,
Pettah Police Station in Crime No. 416/2023
(By A.P.P )
Accused : Aneesh Kumar, Krishna Bhavan, Elambilakathu,
Kuruvikkode, 12" Ward, Kalliyoor.
Offence : u/s 279, 337 and 338 of IPC and section 134(a)
and 134(b) of Motor Vehicles Act
Plea : Guilty
Finding : Guilty
Sentence/order : Accused is sentenced to pay a fine of %.3500/- for the
offence punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 of IPC and
section 134(a) and 134(b) of Motor Vehicles Act
and in default; to undergo simple imprisonment for 35
days.
This case having been heard today, the court passed the following:-
JUDGMENT
1. Accused stands charged with the offences punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 of
IPC and section 134(a) and 134(b) of Motor Vehicles Act.
2. Accused entered appearance. Requirements u/s.207 Cr.PC was complied with.
The particulars of offences were read over and explained to the accused to which
he pleaded guilty. I accept the plea since I am convinced of its genuineness and

that the same is made voluntarily. Hence, I find the accused guilty of the offences
punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 of IPC and section 134(a) and 134(b) of Motor
Vehicles Act and accordingly he is convicted and sentenced to pay a fine of
%.3500/- for the offences u/s 279, 337 and 338 of IPC and section 134(a) and
134(b) of Motor Vehicles Act and in default; to undergo simple imprisonment
for 35 days.
Dated this the 4" day of March 2025.

GH

7 07k A 3 Thiruvananthapuram.
